name: nonequilibrium
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the state of not being in balance: Non-market forces are often there to maintain nonequilibrium, such as wage differential by restriction on labour movement across nations.
chemistry
  specialized a state in which there is no chemical equilibrium (= when the reactants and products in a chemical reaction do not change because the rate of forward reaction is equal to the rate of reverse reaction): By supplying energy from external fluctuations or nonequilibrium chemical reactions, directed motion is possible.
More examplesFewer examplesSpeculation bubbles are real-life examples of nonequilibrium price trends.The semiconductor is in a state of nonequilibrium.The flow exhibited a marked nonequilibrium character.This state of nonequilibrium (straight heating would have kept the system in equilibrium) lowers the resistance.Permanent chemical non-equilibrium between a cell and the outside world supports continuity of the processes.
